no.hig.hers.ludoclient

Class GameClientUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.hig.hers.ludoclient.GameClientUIController

  • public class GameClientUIController
extends java.lang.Object
    GameClientUICOntroller creates the LudoBoardFX class which stores all the game logic. It controls all the movement on the board through the LudoBoardFX class and communicate with the gameserver. It also controls all the GUI of the game scene.
    Author:
    Hauken on 17.11.2015

        LudoBoardFX board

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameClientUIController

        public GameClientUIController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Method that is called when the game starts. Adds the gameboard, make the gamelogic and setup the GUI

      • setUpGUI

        public void setUpGUI()
        Sets up most of the GAMEGUI Sets buttons to be disabled until it is your turn. Also set up the on action for the game buttons except the dice roller. All the on acions will send the values to the game server and then to all the players when pressed. The values will not be process before it is received.

      • setTextOnLabels

        public void setTextOnLabels()
        Sets the correct text for the pawn buttons

      • setPawnMovesFalse

        public void setPawnMovesFalse()
        Sets the pawn buttons to disabled so the player cant use them as long as you dont got a valid move.

      • setNotValidPass

        public void setNotValidPass()
        Sets the pass button to not usable.

      • setValidPass

        public void setValidPass()
        Sets the pass button to usable.

      • setPawnMovesTrue

        public void setPawnMovesTrue(int val)
        If there is a valid move on a pawn, the pawn button is set to usable.
        Parameters:
        val - the value of the valid pawn.

      • setNotValid

        public void setNotValid()
        Sets all the pawns of the current player to not valid.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(int n)
        Sets a player to a color. If the player is player two, he/she starts to roll the dice.
        Parameters:
        n - the player number

      • getPlayer

        public int getPlayer()
        Returns the chosen player. Used to handle disconnects.
        Returns:
        returns the player, or the color in this case.

      • getTurnOwner

        public int getTurnOwner()
        Returns the current turn owner. This is used to check if the player disconnected is the player that is currently rolling.
        Returns:
        returns the turn owner.

      • setPlayerName

        public void setPlayerName(int pnr,
                          java.lang.String name)
        Sets the correct player to the correct color/player label.
        Parameters:
        pnr - player number/color of the player
        name - the name to be set to the label of that color

      • setConnetion

        public void setConnetion(java.io.BufferedWriter write,
                         java.io.BufferedReader read)
        Sets the connection so the controller can communicate with the game server.
        Parameters:
        write - output
        read - input Not used. Is handled by the Gamehandler

      • getDiceValue

        public void getDiceValue(int diceV,
                         int playernr,
                         int pawn)
        Gets the dicevalue, the player that rolled/passed and what pawn that player moved. This is called by the gamehandler and the values is received from the game server. The last player that played sent these values to the game server and this method process them when they return to the players.
        Parameters:
        diceV - the dice value
        playernr - the player that moved/passed
        pawn - the pawn that that the player moved. Is 0 if passed.

      • sendText

        public void sendText(java.lang.String text)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Send the given message to the client. Ensures that all messages have a trailing newline and are flushed.
        Parameters:
        text - the message to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when sending the message

      • sendDiceValue

        public void sendDiceValue(int diceVal,
                          int playernr,
                          int pawn)
        Sends the dicevalue, the player number of the current player and what pawn that is moved to the game server.
        Parameters:
        diceVal - the dice value
        playernr - turn owner
        pawn - Pawned that is moved. 0 if passed

      • sendGameStatus

        public void sendGameStatus()
        Sends that the game is over to the other players and that this player won to the database.

      • passChangeTurnOwner

        public void passChangeTurnOwner()
        Changes the labels when the turn is passed.

      • gameover

        public void gameover()
        Sets the game to be over

      • checkforPlayersGreen

        public void checkforPlayersGreen()
        Sets the correct labels for the green player. If this player is the last man standing, the game is over and that player won.

      • checkforPlayersRed

        public void checkforPlayersRed()
        Sets the correct labels for the red player and changes turn owner. If this player is the last man standing, the game is over and that player won.

      • checkforPlayersYellow

        public void checkforPlayersYellow()
        Sets the correct labels for the yellow player. If this player is the last man standing, the game is over and that player won.

      • checkforPlayersBlue

        public void checkforPlayersBlue()
        Sets the correct labels for the blue player. If this player is the last man standing, the game is over and that player won.

      • setPlayerDisconnect

        public void setPlayerDisconnect(int dced)
        Sets the player that is disconnect to not playing It also sets all the pawns of that color back to home.
        Parameters:
        dced - the disconnected player

      • setDiceImage

        public void setDiceImage(int diceValue)
        Sets a image showing the dice value that is received.
        Parameters:
        diceValue - the dice value
